poem:
### Tariffs and Ties

August's shadow stretches,  
merchandise dreams weighed down;  
rucksacks priced in bloated whispers,  
pencil cases tight-lipped too.  
Sheets of economics curry in the air—  
chalk it up to invisible hands,  
China-bound ships lingering,  
miniature flags stuck in stuck ports.  
Summer folds its wings,  
lesson one: numbers sting.
